channel.title: What is the source of this music
channel.description:
I must find the source of the sampled melody present in these two songs: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GNpH-AJkoMs#t=10s[/url] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aNC7BvesP-8#t=4m12s[/url]
Does it ring any bells with you?

item.title: What is the source of this music
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Sounds familiar, but I can’t place it. My gut feeling says it’s from a movie, but I dunno.

Read full topic
item.source: What is the source of this music

item.title: What is the source of this music
item.dc:creator: Tiki
item.description:
I’ve yet to meet a mod with an orchestral OST, no matter how short of an excerpt… Plus, From South Carolina’s sample seems to have a substantially higher quality than the WAVs which were earlier included with Sweet Half-Life.

Sweet Half-Life was made by a Japanese modder, and Her Space Holiday made a song named Japanese Gum. It is possible that the source is from a Japanese composer.

Read full topic

item.title: What is the source of this music
item.dc:creator: Tiki
item.description:
Problem:* Album The Young Machines, which contains From South Carolina, was released September of 2003.

  • Mod Sweet Half-Life, which includes the loop as the mod’s theme, was released in August of 2001.

Read full topic
